nodes.name: DatasetStructured
nodes.description: This Node creates a DataFrame by reading data from HDFS, HIVE etc. The dataset has been defined earlier in Fire by using the Dataset Feature. As a user, you just have to select the Dataset of your interest.
nodes.details:
This Node creates a DataFrame by reading data from HDFS, HIVE etc.

The data has been defined earlier in Fire by using the Dataset Feature. As a user, you just have to select the Dataset of your interest.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: dataset
fields.title: Dataset
fields.description: Selected Dataset

nodes.name: SQL
nodes.description: This node runs the given SQL on the incoming DataFrame
nodes.hint: Whenever the table is changed, go to Schema tab and Refresh the Schema

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: tempTable
fields.title: Temp Table
fields.description: Temp Table Name to be used

fields.name: sql
fields.value: SELECT fire_temp_table.* , (Total_price-Total_cost) as profit FROM fire_temp_table
fields.title: SQL
fields.description: SQL to be run

nodes.name: RowFilter
nodes.description: This node creates a new DataFrame containing only rows satisfying given condition
nodes.details:
This node creates a new DataFrame containing only rows satisfying the given condition.

Examples of Conditional Expression


col1 > 5 AND col2 > 3

name is not NULL

name is NULL

usd_pledged_real > 0 and (category = "Narrative Film" or category == "Music") and goal > 100

datetime > '2011-01-01 00:00:00.0' (datetime column is of type timestamp)

datetime > '2011-01-01 00:00:00.0' and datetime < '2016-01-01 00:00:00.0'

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: conditionExpr
fields.title: Conditional Expression
fields.description: The filtering condition. Rows not satisfying given condition will be excluded from output DataFrame. eg: usd_pledged_real > 0 and (category = 1 or category == 2) and goal > 100

nodes.name: Split
nodes.description: This node splits the incoming DataFrame into 2. It takes in the fraction to use in splitting the data. For example, if the fraction is .7, it would split the data into 2 DataFrames, one containing 70% of the rows and the other containing the remaining 30%.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: fraction1
fields.title: Fraction 1
fields.description: Fraction to be used for Splitting the DataFrame into two. The first DataFrame would go to the lower edge output. The other would go to the higher edge output.

nodes.name: LinearRegression
nodes.description: The interface for working with linear regression models and model summaries is similar to the logistic regression case.
nodes.details:
The interface for working with linear regression models and model summaries is similar to the logistic regression case.

More at Spark MLlib/ML docs page : spark.apache.org/docs/latest/ml-classification-regression.html#linear-regression

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: featuresCol
fields.title: Features Column
fields.description: Features column of type vectorUDT for model fitting

fields.name: labelCol
fields.title: Label Column
fields.description: The label column for model fitting

fields.name: predictionCol
fields.title: Prediction Column
fields.description: The prediction column created during model scoring

fields.name: fitIntercept
fields.title: Fit Intercept
fields.description: Whether to fit an intercept term

fields.name: maxIter
fields.title: Maximum Iterations
fields.description: Maximum number of iterations (>= 0)

fields.name: regParam
fields.title: Regularization Param
fields.description: The regularization parameter

fields.name: elasticNetParam
fields.title: ElasticNet Param
fields.description: The ElasticNet mixing parameter. For alpha = 0, the penalty is an L2 penalty. For alpha = 1, it is an L1 penalty

fields.name: solver
fields.title: Solver
fields.description: The solver algorithm for optimization

fields.name: standardization
fields.title: Standardization
fields.description: Whether to standardize the training features before fitting the model

fields.name: tol
fields.title: Tolerance
fields.description: The convergence tolerance for iterative algorithms

fields.name: weightCol
fields.title: Weight Column
fields.description: If the 'weight column' is not specified, all instances are treated equally with a weight 1.0

fields.name: regParamGrid
fields.title: Regularization Param Grid Search
fields.description: Regularization Parameters for Grid Search

fields.name: elasticNetGrid
fields.title: ElasticNet Param Grid Search
fields.description: ElasticNet Parameters for Grid Search

fields.name: maxIterGrid
fields.title: MaxIter Param Grid Search
fields.description: Maximum iteration Parameters for Grid Search

fields.name: comment
fields.value:
Dummy sales data set contains the unit price and volume sold in the last 2 months for 3 different products.

By using this history data create a linear model and check the elasticity of a product
